name: Baked French Toast
ingredients: 1 loaf french bread (13-­‐16 oz.) ¼ tsp. cinnamon
2 cups half and half dash salt
1 cup packed light brown sugar ½ tsp. cinnamon
1 cup chopped pecans ½ tsp. nutmeg
2 rows, overlapping the slices. In a large bowl, combine eggs, half and half, milk, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg,
steps: ½ lb. softened butter 2 T. light corn syrup
Slice french bread into 20 slices, one inch each. Arrange slices in a generously buttered 9x13 flat baking dish in
and salt and beat with a rotary beater or whisk until blended but not too bubbly. (I have used a blender.) Pour
mixture over the bread slices, making sure all are covered evenly with the milk-­‐egg mixture. Spoon some of the
mixture between the slices. I like to press the slices down into the mixture at the bottom of the pan to make sure it
all soaks in. Cover with foil and refrigerate overnight. In the morning, press slices to make sure all is absorbed
evenly. Preheat the oven to 350°. Spread the Praline Topping evenly over the bread and bake for 40 minutes,
